commitAddToken(IBPool,address,uint256,ui.details: Not sure about the naming here. Kind of reversed; I would think you would "Apply" to add     a token, then "Commit" it to actually do the binding.

applyAddToken(ConfigurableRightsPool,IBP.notice: Add the token previously committed (in commitAddToken) to the pool

commitAddToken(IBPool,address,uint256,ui.notice: Schedule (commit) a token to be added; must call applyAddToken after a fixed        number of blocks to actually add the token

exitPool(ConfigurableRightsPool,IBPool,u.notice: Exit a pool - redeem pool tokens for underlying assets

exitswapExternAmountOut(ConfigurableRigh.notice: Exit a pool - redeem pool tokens for a specific amount of underlying assets        Asset must be present in the pool

exitswapPoolAmountIn(ConfigurableRightsP.notice: Exit a pool - redeem a specific number of pool tokens for an underlying asset        Asset must be present in the pool, and will incur an EXIT_FEE (if set to non-zero)

joinswapExternAmountIn(ConfigurableRight.notice: Join by swapping a fixed amount of an external token in (must be present in the pool)        System calculates the pool token amount

joinswapPoolAmountOut(ConfigurableRights.notice: Join by swapping an external token in (must be present in the pool)        To receive an exact amount of pool tokens out. System calculates the deposit amount

pokeWeights(IBPool,uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: External function called to make the contract update weights according to plan

removeToken(ConfigurableRightsPool,IBPoo.notice: Remove a token from the pool

updateWeight(ConfigurableRightsPool,IBPo.notice: Update the weight of an existing token

updateWeightsGradually(IBPool,SmartPoolM.notice: Update weights in a predetermined way, between startBlock and endBlock,        through external cals to pokeWeights
